page.title: 20POPULATION
page.content: The recent years have seen a dramatic and significant change in the population of this area. A decline of 18.35% (some 1,730 people) occurred between 1961-1971, this trend still continues. The majority of the decline was experienced in the 0 - 14 and 15 - 44 male and female age groups, the numbers of which fell by 20% and 31% respectively. An increase in the population over retirement age was also noticed. The decline in population is accounted for by lower fertility rates than e.g. the rest of Mid-Glamorgan and by the rate of mig- ration from the valley. This decline is manifested in a falling school pop- ulation and an increase on demand e.g. on care provision for the elderly. The last official figures gave this area a population of 7698 which represents some 8.65% of the total pop.of Rhondda
